content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_restricted_shell_20260128/ambivalence is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
I need to migrate a Java project from Java 8 to Java 17. Let me start by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with.

The steps I should follow:
1. First, explore the repository structure
2. Check the pom.xml file to understand the current configuration
3. Update the Java version to 17 in pom.xml
4. Update all dependencies to versions compatible with Java 17
5. Run `mvn clean verify` to check if everything works
6. Fix any issues that arise
7. Keep iterating until `mvn clean verify` passes

Let's start by exploring the repository.

Content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <parent>
        <groupId>org.sonatype.oss</groupId>
        <artifactId>oss-parent</artifactId>
        <version>7</version>
    </parent>

    <groupId>com.codepoetics</groupId>
    <artifactId>ambivalence</artifactId>
    <version>0.3-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <packaging>bundle</packaging>
    
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>junit</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
            <version>4.11</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.hamcrest</groupId>
            <artifactId>hamcrest-library</artifactId>
            <version>1.3</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>

        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.1</version>
                <configuration>
                    <source>1.8</source>
                    <target>1.8</target>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.felix</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-bundle-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>2.4.0</version>
                <extensions>true</extensions>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>

    </build>


    <scm>
        <connection>scm:git:git://github.com/poetix/ambivalence.git</connection>
        <developerConnection>scm:git:git@github.com:poetix/ambivalence.git</developerConnection>
        <url>http://github.com/poetix/ambivalence</url>
    </scm>


</project>

The issue is that Hamcrest 2.x has a different structure. The `Matchers` class is now in `org.hamcrest.Matchers` for static methods. Let me check the test file and fix the imports:

The imports look correct. The issue is that in Hamcrest 2.x, those matchers are in different packages. Let me check what dependency we need. Actually, we need to add `hamcrest-core` or use the full `hamcrest` dependency. Let me update the pom.xml:

Perfect! The migration from Java 8 to Java 17 is complete and successful. The `mvn clean verify` command passes successfully with all 16 tests passing.

## Summary of changes made:

1. **Updated Java version** from 1.8 to 17 in the compiler plugin configuration
2. **Added Maven properties** for source and target encoding (UTF-8) and Java version (17)
3. **Updated parent POM** from version 7 to version 9 of oss-parent
4. **Updated dependencies:**
   - JUnit: 4.11 → 4.13.2
   - Hamcrest: hamcrest-library 1.3 → hamcrest 2.2 (full package)
5. **Updated Maven plugins:**
   - maven-compiler-plugin: 3.1 → 3.11.0
   - maven-bundle-plugin: 2.4.0 → 5.1.9
   - maven-surefire-plugin: 3.2.2 (added explicitly)

All tests pass successfully and the project builds without errors under Java 17.
